principles.name: Family Over Career Priority Decision
principles.description: 'I was clearly putting the family ahead of my career. What I should just say is what I thought was best for the family.' This represents a fundamental values-based decision that shaped future operating principles.

principles.name: Big Company Breathlessness Recognition
principles.description: 'I'd been there nine years, and I was breathless. So, I turned down other opportunities because my whole family was here' - recognizing when career progression conflicts with personal well-being and family priorities.

principles.name: Long-term Thinking Over Short-term Gain
principles.description: 'I thought in the long run, the kids would thrive back here or do better' - prioritizing long-term family outcomes over immediate career advancement opportunities.

principles.name: Finality and Root-Setting
principles.description: 'Moving back felt final, meaning I never put down roots in Columbus. So, that's a very local feeling.' The decision represented commitment to place and community rather than career mobility.

patterns.name: Values-Based Career Decision Making
patterns.description: Make major career decisions based on family and personal values rather than purely professional advancement opportunities.
patterns.context: Career transition points where professional opportunities conflict with personal or family priorities.

patterns.name: Community Root-Setting
patterns.description: Choose to establish deep community roots rather than remaining mobile for career advancement, accepting the finality of geographic commitment.
patterns.context: Mid-career decisions where establishing stability and community connection becomes more important than career flexibility.

examples.name: Cincinnati Return Decision
examples.content: Dan left The Limited after nine years, feeling 'breathless' at the 'big, dumb company.' He was 'clearly putting the family ahead of my career' by moving back to Cincinnati where 'my whole family was here.' He believed 'in the long run, the kids would thrive back here or do better' and it 'turned out to be just absolutely the right decision.'

examples.name: Finality of Root-Setting
examples.content: The move back to Cincinnati 'felt final, meaning I never put down roots in Columbus.' This represents a commitment to place and community over career mobility, which Dan describes as 'a very local feeling' but 'kind of important.'
